DPi.content: “right to life (laissez-les-vivre),” in name of Christ, in name of human life > must interrogate why these militants usually for DP
DPi.linkedContent: “right to life (laissez-les-vivre),” in name of Christ, in name of human life > must interrogate why these militants usually for DP

DPi.content: for Kant, maternal infanticide (putting to death child born out of wedlock) & death in duel not punishable by death (former, to save honor of feminine sex)
DPi.linkedContent: for Kant, maternal infanticide (putting to death child born out of wedlock) & death in duel not punishable by death (former, to save honor of feminine sex)

DPi.content: put to death child born outside marriage because outside law (ignore annihilation of contraband merchandise, i.e. child out of wedlock)
DPi.linkedContent: put to death child born outside marriage because outside law (ignore annihilation of contraband merchandise, i.e. child out of wedlock)

DPi.content: for Kant, justice finds itself here in double bind, knot: either honor (Ehrbegriff) is vain or DP should simply be set aside > Die Auflösung dieses Knotens: no more DP when law (CI) & nature align
DPi.linkedContent: for Kant, justice finds itself here in double bind, knot: either honor (Ehrbegriff) is vain or DP should simply be set aside > Die Auflösung dieses Knotens: no more DP when law (CI) & nature align

DPi.content: no more need to not DP women, they’ll never marry out of wedlock (Derrida adds: extraordinary & stupid uselessness, rigor & absurdity of Kant’s logic)
DPi.linkedContent: no more need to not DP women, they’ll never marry out of wedlock (Derrida adds: extraordinary & stupid uselessness, rigor & absurdity of Kant’s logic)

DPi.content: God sentenced Jesus to death for being an illegitimate child (a paternal version of Kant’s infanticide)
DPi.linkedContent: God sentenced Jesus to death for being an illegitimate child (a paternal version of Kant’s infanticide)

DST.content: delay as inevitable, delay re: one’s “own” birth, experience of “abortion” > a subject that cannot identify itself because ineluctably delayed [Lacan’s human born prematurely]
DST.linkedContent: delay as inevitable, delay re: one’s “own” birth, experience of “abortion” > a subject that cannot identify itself because ineluctably delayed [Lacan’s human born prematurely]

DST.content: abortive: a birth takes place w/out taking place: event of a singular failure, “comes to itself only to lose itself” [re: Lacoue-Labarthe on Reik’s theory of autobiography]
DST.linkedContent: abortive: a birth takes place w/out taking place: event of a singular failure, “comes to itself only to lose itself” [re: Lacoue-Labarthe on Reik’s theory of autobiography]

HST.content: substitution, cloning, series; where does human begin? abortion: subject hôte-hostage, clone w/out father?
